title: Fiesta of the Damned
author: Guy Adams
filename: 215 - Fiesta of the Damned - Guy Adams_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
1. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. SPANISH HILLSIDE. A SMALL UNIT OF AROUND TWENTY SOLDIERS
CAMPED. CRACKLE OF A BONFIRE. PEOPLE MOVING AROUND, EATING, MUMBLING.
SOLDIERS x 2: I can’t eat this, I’1l be dead by morning!/ Look at the state of my feet, more blisters than toes.../
(JOKING) Philippe, don’t just sit there! We don’t keep you around for your skills as a soldier. Play something!
(LAUGHS) Sir.
FX. HE BEGINS TO PLAY THE GUITAR, ‘ROMANCE ANONIMO’ — A
SPANISH TUNE THAT’S EASY FOR PEOPLE TO HUM LATER.
That’s better, now if we can teach Rodrigo to cook we might all survive a few more months in the Republican army.
FX. SCRAPING OF FORK IN CANTEEN AS HE TAKES A BITE OF HIS MEAL.
(DISGUST) Although perhaps that would be a miracle too far.
What is this, Commander? Rabbit? Boar?
Whatever it is, Senor Newman, I’m not sure it’s dead yet.
I think I’d sooner eat Phillipe’s guitar.
Ah... but then you’d miss my beautiful music. Listen...
FX. HE PLAYS A FLOURISH. IN THE DISTANCE SOUND OF BOMBER PLANE APPROACHING.
Shut up a minute... You hear that?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 3
FX. PHILLIPE STOPS PLAYING, PLANE ENGINE GETTING LOUDER.
Plane coming in from the north!
This far into Republican territory? Damn it! (SHOUTING, BATTLE STATIONS) Get that fire out! Quickly!
SOLDIERS x 2: Shovel, quickly!/ Put that cigar out! /Find cover!
FX. SOMEONE STARTS SHOVELLING DIRT ONTO THE FIRE. GENERAL PANIC. PLANE GETTING LOUDER. THE SOLDIERS GO QUIET.
Let’s just hope they didn’t spot us already.
Clear night like this? They probably saw us from miles away.
FX. THE PLANE IS ALMOST OVERHEAD.
(WHISPERS TO HIMSELF) On your way my Nationalist friends, nothing to see here.
FX. A WHISTLE AS A BOMB FALLS.
Bombing run! (SHOUTS) Spread out! Take cover!
FX. THE BOMB HITS. PLANE FADING AS IT PASSES OVER.
SOLDIERS x 2:
WOUNDED, CRY OUT
FX. CRACKLE OF FIRES.
(COUGHING) Quiet, everyone! Quiet! Who is wounded?
FX. TREES CRACKING, BEGINNING TO FALL.
What’s that noise...?
The trees are falling!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 4
Mind your backs!
FX. A TREE FALLS. THEN ANOTHER. BEAT.
Everyone all right?
FX. THE ENGINE BEGINS TO GET LOUDER AS THE PLANE TURNS BACK.
The bomber! He’s coming back for another pass!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 5
2. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. THE PLANE ENGINE IN THE DISTANCE, THE SOUND OF THE TARDIS MATERIALISING. THE DOOR OPENS AND THE DOCTOR STEPS OUT.
Here we are! As promised, a taste of the real Spain.
FX. HE WALKS OFF. ACE AND MEL EXIT TARDIS.
Well, it can’t be worse than Ricosta.
I wouldn’t bet on it, Donut.
FX: ACE CLOSES THE DOOR BEHIND. THEY FOLLOW THE DOCTOR.
Sea air! Sunshine!
Doctor, it’s night-time.
Patience, Ace. Everything comes to she who waits.
What’s that over there?
What’s what over where?
Light, coming through the trees — see?
(NOT LISTENING) Lazy days on the beach...
Flames, more like. Doctor...
(STILL OBLIVIOUS) .. all the peace and quiet you could want...
FX. THE PLANE ENGINE IS VERY LOUD NOW.
(SHOUTING) What’s that awful noise?
(NOT CONVINCED) Someone mowing their lawn?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 6
FX. WHISTLING AS A BOMB DROPS
Bomb!
Get back to the TARDIS!
Get down!!!
FX. BOMB EXPLODES. RESPONSE NOISES FROM THE DOCTOR, ACE AND MEL AS THEY’RE KNOCKED OFF THEIR FEET.
DOCTOR, ACE & MEL: Ahh! Ooh!! Oof!!
FX. TWO MORE BOMBS FALLING, STAGGERED DISTANCE.
Stay down!
FX. TWO MORE EXPLOSIONS, A LITTLE WAY OFF.
Doctor? Ace? Are you alright?
(COUGHS) Yeah, fine.
Careful, Ace. The bombing’s disturbed the ground.
It looks solid enough to me— Whoaa!
FX. A ROAR OF SHIFTING DIRT, THE EARTH SPLITTING.
It’s... giving way... Caving in!
Ace, I warned you!
I can’t... (get a grip) I’m slipping!
FX. SCRABBLING AT THE SHIFTING EARTH.
(TO ACE) Grab my hand! (SHOUTING) Doctor!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 7
I’m here. Hold the end of my umbrella, I’1l.. (STRAINING) Pull you both...
FX. EFFORT NOISES FROM ALL. ACE SCRABBLING AT THE DIRT, TRYING TO GET A GRIP.
Just a bit more...
That’s it, nearly there!
ACE/MEL/DOCTOR:
EFFORT.. THEN GASPS AS THEY FALL BACK, EXHAUSTED
BEAT.
(GETTING UP) “All the peace and quiet you could want,” he says...
Seconds after leaving the TARDIS and I’m nearly six feet under.
We need to get back to the TARDIS.
Easier said than done, I can’t see a thing... (COUGHS)
Bombs kicking up the dirt. (COUGHS) It’s all been churned up.
(SPITTING OUT DIRT) Well, this is a lovely holiday so far.
With the Doctor? I’ve had worse.
You know what? So have I. We must need our heads examining.
(LAUGHS) Club Type 40, see the universe and run for your life!
FX. PLANE ENGINE GROWING DISTANT.
Quickly, while it’s turning, we need to move!
Which way?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 8
(RUNNING OFF) Towards the fires! It must be some sort of camp!
(TO HERSELF) And off he runs towards danger.
There may be someone who needs our help. (SHE RUNS)
Suppose you’re right. (SHE FOLLOWS)
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 9
3. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. ROMERO AND THE SOLDIERS RUNNING. THE PLANE TURNING FOR ONE
BOMBING RUN.
Come on! Keep moving! It’s not finished with us yet. That’s it, faster... You three! Over here! Quickly!
FX. THE DOCTOR, ACE AND MEL RUN UP TO HIM.
Hello... err, Captain?
(SHOCKED NOW HE CAN SEE THEM) Who in the name of the devil are
you?
I’m the Doctor and these are my friends, [Ace and M—]
Save it, Professor! (CALLING) Everyone — run!
FX. SHE SHOVES HIM AND THEY ALL RUN TOGETHER.
(TO PHILLIPPE) I take it that bomber is after all of you?
They are Nationalists, they are always after us!
Why, is your guitar that bad?
FX. PLANE SOARING OVERHEAD.
He’s coming back!
Just keep running!
FX. IT DROPS ANOTHER BOMB. WHISTLE. BOOM! PHILLIPE SCREAMS.
Aaahh!!!
Phillipe!
FX. GROUND CAVING IN.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 10
Get back! The ground’s caving in again!
No! Phillipe!
FX. RUMBLE OF TUMBLING DIRT AND ROCK. PHILLIPE SCREAMS, ECHOING
UNDER GROUND.
You can’t help him. I’m sorry. He’s gone.
The plane’s banking away.
Probably out of bombs.
The ones he had were more than enough.
FX. THE PLANE FADES AWAY COMPLETELY, LEAVING THE CRACKLE OF FIRES. ALL BREATHLESS.
Ace, Mel, are you alright?
Fine. I think.
Yeah, I’m OK. Better than some. I’ve lost my bearings though, which way back to the TARDIS?
I think it’s that way.
(SHOUTING IN THE DISTANCE) Those of you who can walk help those who can’t. We need to find shelter.
But we can’t just leave them, can we? Shouldn’t we help?
Of course we should. The TARDIS will be alright. Probably.
FX. GEORGE NEWMAN WALKS OVER.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 11
Do I hear English voices?
Er, yes!
You’re a long way from home, my friends.
You too, Mister.
George Newman, The Times, reporting on the war.
And how’s that going for you?
Journalism under fire, can’t beat it.
(DISAPPROVING) Well I’m glad someone’s having fun. (QUIET, TO THE DOCTOR) Doctor, you do realise you’ve managed to land us in
the middle of a war?
(QUIET, TO MEL) Well, if your species will keep having then... (TO NEWMAN) Pleased to meet you, Mr Newman. I’m the Doctor,
these are my friends Ace and Mel.
What are you doing here, all of you?
You know. Just passing through.
Tourists?!
In a way. Who’s the Captain?
and
(SINCERE, BUT JOCULAR) That, madam, is Juan Romero, Republican
hero and man of the people.
Yeah, I can tell he’s popular on account of how someone’s trying to blow him up.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 12
I’ve been stationed with him and his men for the last few weeks. Up until now things had been rather quiet.
We must be bad luck. (QUIET) What war is this, anyway?
What [war?!]
(CUTTING IN) The Spanish Civil War, obviously.
(SARCASTIC) Obviously.
You said you were... passing through?
We were heading towards the... (BLUFFING) .. er, the town.

Farissa? [‘FA-REE-SA’] Small place, I don’t know it. We’ll be heading there ourselves now, I suspect, given we’ve got so many wounded. This part of the coast is mainly Republican, but Romero prefers to camp in the open. Any town or village becomes a target if we enter it. Best not to draw the civilians into the fight if possible.
Quite right.
FX. ROMERO WALKS OVER.
You said you were a Doctor? I have wounded men.
I’1ll help if I can.
FX. HE AND ROMERO WALK OFF.
It probably sounds mad but it’s almost a relief to have
Franco’s boys take a pop at us.
It does sound mad, yes. People are dead.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 13

(COLD) I’m fully aware of that, miss. They were my friends after all. (BEAT) I meant, after a while the quiet makes you nervous. You know the attack will come sooner or later but waiting for it is torture.
(REALISING SHE MISREAD HIM) Sorry, I didn’t mean to seem rude.
No offence taken. It must be hard for a woman to understand.
I beg your pardon?
Well, you know — war and fighting, it’s man’s business. The battlefield’s no place for a woman.
(AGGRESSIVELY) What did you say?
Er.. present company excepted?
Don’t add to the casualties Ace, we’ve enough on our hands as Le Ass
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 14
4. EXT HILLSIDE.
FX. THE DOCTOR APPROACHES ROMERO.
Most of your men are safe to move, Commander. I’11 do what I can when we get to Farissa.
Thank you, Doctor.
FX. THE DOCTOR STOOPS DOWN TO LOOK INTO THE HOLE IN THE GROUND.
VOICE NOW HAS A SLIGHT ECHO.
Fascinating, the bombing’s exposed a whole network of caves.
They must run all the way through the hillside.
I wonder how deep they are? — Pass me that stone.
FX. ROMERO SCRABBLES IN THE DIRT AND DOES SO. THE DOCTOR THROWS IT INTO THE CHASM, IT BOUNCES AND ECHOES.
Deep.
Deep enough. I lost a good man down there.
(CONTRITE) Yes, sorry, insensitive of me.
We’re at war, who has time for sensitivity?
Every life is precious. Every death a crime. What was his name, the man you lost?
Phillipe. We grew up in the same village. Played together, fished together... (BEAT) Killed together.
We choose what to remember and what to forget. That’s our right.
Then I’1l remember the fishing. And his guitar playing.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 15
Ah yes, I noticed the guitar. Before all this he was a musician?
In a fair world that’s all he would have been.
Oh to live in a fair world.
Some of us are trying to do just that. (BEAT) We need to move, before I have other old friends to mourn.
FX. THEY WALK AWAY. WE LINGER. A BEAT. THEN A DISTANT CRACKLED BURST OF ELECTRICITY. THEN ANOTHER. THEN A VERY LOW HUM AS
POWERS UP. FINALLY, A NEW NOISE:
(‘ZOMBIEFIED’ ) (FX. HEAVY ECHO AND SLIGHT DISTORT) (SINGS TUNE HE WAS PLAYING EARLIER, BROKEN, OUT-OF-TUNE, A SONG SUNG BY DEAD MAN’S LIPS.)
MUSIC: RIFFING OFF THE SONG, TO COMPLETELY NAIL IT FOR THE
LISTENER. TRANSITION.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 16
5. EXT. HILLSIDE. (LATER
FX. FADE UP. THE BAND OF MEN MARCHING.
Come on, you lot! Keep up, we’ll rest when we’re safe.
(APPROACHING ACE) Ace... Ace!
Oh, it’s you. Do you like bruises, or something?
Cos I thought you’d come over to check if I could keep the pace. Seeing as I’m a woman.
You’re an unusual one, that’s for sure.
You’re just asking for trouble now.
Trouble doesn’t bother me. I’ve had my fair share it over here.
As a reporter? Typewriter fights back, does it?
Yes, well — to tell you the truth, we’re not supposed to get involved in the fighting. It’s frowned upon. But I’ve always found it hard not to get involved.
(BEAT, A HINT OF WARMTH) Yeah, I know what you mean.

‘A reporter must stay objective’, or so my editor tells me. But when you’re marching with good men, when the bullets start to fly.. well, you can’t just sit on your hands and hide behind your press credentials.
Even when it’s not your war?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 17
Isn’t it? Just because I didn’t grow up here, am I supposed to be blind to my principles? I’m here, I’ve taken sides, it’s my war right enough.
And if the side you’ve picked starts to lose? What do you do then?
(QUIET) The Republicans are already losing. They sued for peace back in May but Franco was having none of it. He knew he could press his advantage home.
So they keep fighting.
To the last man, probably. That’s the cost of principles.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 18
elements.character: CROSS TO ELSEWHERE IN THE LINE

elements.text: 6. EXT. HILLSIDE [CONTINUOUS].
FX. MARCHING.
elements.character: CROSS TO ELSEWHERE IN THE LINE

elements.text: (QUIET) ‘A taste of the real Spain’?
A taste of the real Spain in the winter of 1938, certainly. (BEAT) I’m sorry I brought you here, Mel.
I remember how it used to be with you. History hurts.
It can do, yes. It can also inspire. An opportunity to meet the guiding lights of human experience.
Like Juan Romero?
(UNCERTAIN, WITH SADNESS) Possibly.
Have you heard of him?
No.
That doesn’t bode well.
We can’t all be famous. Even the footnotes are inspiring sometimes.
He seems a good man.
In war? Is there such a thing?
Isn’t that a bit rich coming from you?
Oh, I wouldn’t say I was a good man either. Just another misguided fool trying his best.
His men seem devoted to him, certainly.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 19
Yes, poor man. I hope his shoulders are broad enough to take the weight.
(SHOUTING IN THE DISTANCE) Brave heart my friends, not far now. We’ll soon be safe and sound.
(MUTTERING) If only...
If only? (SIGHS) What exactly do you know?
(MOURNFUL) The future. That’s the trouble with history, it’s already been written.
(QUIET) The Republicans lose, you mean?
Yes, they do. Badly.
And here we are, getting involved as always.
As always.
MUSIC: TRANSITION
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 20
7. EXT. FARISSA GATES. (LATER
FX. FADE UP. THE SOUND OF A CHURCH BELL RINGING CONTINUOUSLY AS THE SOLDIERS REACH THE GATES OF FARISSA. ROMERO’S ARMY COMING TO A HALT.
Farissa, finally.. Seems like they saw us coming.
(COMING OVER) Ask not for whom the bell tolls, Commander.
Hopefully we’1l be welcome.
And if not?
I have wounded, Doctor, and we’ve lost a lot of supplies.
(BEAT) So you won’t take no for an answer. (DRY) Well, yes, let’s hope we are welcome then.
(SHOUTS) Hello! I am Juan Romero of the People’s Republican Army. I have men in need of shelter.
FX. THE TOLLING BELL CEASES.
Just beyond the gates there, someone’s coming out.
They’re sending people rather than bullets. I suppose that bodes well.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 21
elements.character: CROSS TO ELSEWHERE IN THE LINE

elements.text: 8. EXT. FARISSA GATES (CONTINUOUS) .
Hello, who’s this then?
If it’s a welcoming committee it doesn’t look too threatening, it’s wearing pyjamas.
(DISTANT, SHOUTED) I am Antonio Ruiz [ROO-EETH] Ferrando, mayor of Farissa. Juan Romero, your reputation precedes you.
Is that a good thing?
In Republican territory? You’d hope so. I suppose we’1ll find
out in a minute.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 22
9. EXT. FARISSA GATES. [CONTINUOUS]
FX. ROMERO APPROACHES FERRANDO
Senor Ferrando, I apologise for disturbing the peace of your town... and dragging you from your bed.
The bombs already did that. Lighting up the mountains like fiesta day.
They took us by surprise. It’s not normal to have enemy planes this deep in friendly territory.
The tide is turning, I fear. The Nationalists are growing bolder.
We’ll have to see what we can do about that. But first we need to gather our strength. The attack took its toll. Several of my men were wounded.
We don’t have much, but we’ll share it nonetheless. Tell your troops to enter with our blessing.
Thank you. We won’t outstay our welcome.
Our town is at your disposal.
Nonetheless, we will leave as soon as we can. I have no wish to make you a target.
(SIGHS) Let us be honest with one another. You already have, my friend.
These days, nowhere is safe.
And tonight, Farissa has learned that only too well.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 23
10: EXT HILLSIDE.
FX. PHILLIPE CLIMBING OUT OF THE CAVERN. DUST AND ROCK SPILLING IN HIS WAKE. FIRES STILL BURN AROUND HIM. HE FALLS, HITTING THE GROUND WITH A HEAVY THUD. HE GETS TO HIS FEET AND BEGINS TO
ALONG, ONE LEG DRAGGING BEHIND IN THE DIRT.
(TUNELESS SINGING AS BEFORE, MINIMAL EFFORT NOISE, HE IS
MORE THAN AN AUTOMATON )
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 24
11. EXT. FARISSA STREET.
FX. ROMERO’S ARMY MARCHES THROUGH THE STREETS. OCCASTONALLY
CREAK OPEN OR WINDOW SHUTTERS SLAM CLOSED.
Look at the townspeople, Doctor, peering out from behind their doors and windows. They’re terrified.
Not of the soldiers. Of what the soldiers may bring.
FX. ACE AND NEWMAN RUN UP TO JOIN THEM.
They should be safe. The Nationalists don’t make a habit of bombing towns this close to Valencia, they have bigger targets there.
Tell that to the bloke who was dropping the bombs earlier.
Honestly, it’s rare. Franco is still trying to curry favour with the common man. This is a war fought with propaganda as much as bombs.
For their sake I hope you’re right.
For all our sakes.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 25
12. EXT. CHURCH.
FX. ROMERO AND FERRANDO WALKING ALONG, ROMERO’S MEN FOLLOWING BEHIND.
Space is limited, but we can fit your men in the church.
We'd be happy just camping in the square.
The least we can offer is a roof.
FX. STOPS, PUSHES OPEN THE CHURCH DOORS. HEAVY CREAK, BIG,
DOORS.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 26
13. INT. CHURCH. [CONTINUOUS]
FX. FERRANDO AND ROMERO ENTER, COMING TO A HALT JUST INSIDE THE DOORWAY.
We have a little more space in the town hall, if this isn’t enough. But this is God’s house, and it should be a place of refuge.
Perhaps the wounded can be billeted in the town hall? It’s as well they have their own space, so that... (TRAILS OFF, HE
IT’S BEST NOT TO GIVE A FULL EXPLANATION)
(UNDERSTANDING ANYWAY) So that their cries don’t disturb the rest of your men? I may just be a small town official, Senor Romero, but I’m not entirely fragile.
I meant no disrespect.
I’m no stranger to death. I lost my son to the war, he died in Galicia.
My condolences.

Thank you. So you understand when I say that what I’m doing is not kindness, it’s duty. I may not be fighting in the war but I will do what I can. If we clear the pews there should be room for your men to bed down.

This is luxury compared to our usual camp, I assure you. I’1l have my men clear the space. (SHOUTS) Jorge [HOR-HEY], Daniel [DAN-EE-ELL], gather a party to shift the furniture. Carefully, remember we’re guests.
FX. 2 x MEN RUN FORWARD, START TO SHIFT THE PEWS.
Now, if you will forgive me, I will return to my bed.
Of course, sleep well.
I will try, but rarely do.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 27
FX. FERRANDO EXITS.
That’s it, clear it all right back. Jorge? Let’s have the field radio set up at the back, once we’re clear you can call in our position.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 28
14. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. THE WHIRRING OF CICADAS. THEY STOP, SILENCE, THEN THE LIVING-DEAD PHILLIPE DRAGS HIMSELF PAST US.
TUNELESS SINGING AS BEFORE
FX. PHILLIPE FADES OUT. BEAT. CICADAS RESUME.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 29
15. EXT. CHURCH
FX. THE DOCTOR, ACE & MEL ARE SAT OUTSIDE THE CHURCH, WE CAN HEAR THE FAINT SOUND OF PEWS BEING SHIFTED INSIDE.
Shouldn’t we be helping clear the place?
They can manage, best not to interfere in history.
(SARCASTIC) Especially when it involves heavy lifting?
Yes, especially then.
So, let me see if I’ve got this straight. A few years ago, a group of conservative generals declared a coup on the democratic government.
Under the leadership of José Sanjurjo [SAN-HUR-HO], yes.
Hang on, I thought they were led by Franco?
Sanjurjo died in a plane crash returning from exile. He was carrying too much luggage.
Luggage?
It was a small plane, it couldn’t take the weight.
(INCREDULOUS) So why did he pack it all?
He said it was important he looked impressive when he took power.
Death by vanity. Right. Even dictators like a nice suit. So then Franco took over?
Yes.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 30
But what are they actually fighting about?
The usual. Politics and religion. The Nationalists believed the Republicans were destabilising the country, eradicating Catholic values, flirting with communism... blah blah...
And the Republicans?
The Republicans believe a country should be run democratically, fairer hours for the working man, a move towards a secular government...
So the Republicans are the good guys?
In war there’s no such thing. They’ve both committed their share of atrocities.
But they’re better than the Nationalists?
(NOT WANTING TO COMMIT) Perhaps.
It doesn’t matter anyway, right? The Nationalists win?
The Battle of the Ebro River has just been fought. Tens of thousands of dead on both sides. It was the deciding battle, the Republicans never recover.
They’re on the run.
Withdrawing to their safe territories, yes. In a few months those territories will fall. Catalonia, Tarragona, Barcelona...
Valencia?
One of the very last to fall. The Republicans will once more try and negotiate a peace, but Franco will only accept an unconditional surrender.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 31
And they give it to him.
What choice will they have?
What happens then? To people like Romero?
Some escape to other countries. Many are executed, at least thirty thousand.
Thirty thousand?
At least. It depends who you believe. Other estimates creep as high as two hundred thousand.
That’s.. (CAN’T THINK OF A STRONG ENOUGH WORD)
War, Mel.
And Franco takes over Spain.
And rules it for thirty-six years, until his death in nineteen seventy-five.
It worked out quite well for him, then.
Oh yes.
So there’s no point in anything Romero and his men do?
Of course there’s a point. We all have to die someday, it’s how we live that matters. On the subject of which...
FX. GETS TO HIS FEET.
I’m going to see what I can do about the wounded.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 32
And what do you want us to do?
Whatever you like, just be careful...
FX. HE WALKS OFF.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 33
16. INT. FERRANDO’S HOUSE
FX. FERRANDO ENTERS HIS STUDY. CLOSES THE DOOR BEHIND HIM.
Peace at last. Oh to close my front door on all of the world’s troubles. And to keep it closed.
FX. UNSCREWS A BOTTLE, POURS HIMSELF A DRINK.
Alfredo my boy, why will you never hang straight?
FX. HE SHIFTS A PICTURE ON THE WALL.
Blame Dolores, eh son? She never puts the pictures back properly after she cleans.
FX. TAKES A SIP OF HIS DRINK.

Or perhaps it’s just the weight of your medals, eh? Pulling you down to one side? (BEAT) Much good they did you. The war has come knocking on our door. Juan Romero, the hero, the living legend. (BEAT) One of the lucky ones, one of the few still alive.
FX. ANOTHER SIP.

But for how long I wonder? How long for any of us? They’re winning Alfredo. In fact they’ve probably already won, the rest of us just haven’t had the common sense to lie down and die yet. So what was the point? What was any of it for?
FX. DRAINS HIS DRINK.
No hero’s death for any of us, my son, just names on a ledger. Enemies of the state. To hell with us all.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 34
17. INT. TOWN HALL
FX. THE DOCTOR WALKING BETWEEN BEDS.
MOANS OF PAIN, NO DIALOGUE
FX. THE DOCTOR STOPS BY HIS SIDE.
Peace now, run away to dreams.
FX. SILENCE FALLS.
That’s it, sleep, the best thing.
FX. ROMERO ENTERS
Doctor? How are my men?
Malnourished, fatigued, on the brink of collapse. (BEAT) And as for the wounded...
The war takes its toll.

NEWMAN: Just a moment, I don’t want to touch this thing with my bare hands.
NEWMAN: FX. THE SWARM SUDDENLY ERUPTS INTO THE CAVERN, A HUGE, WALL OF SOUND.
ACE: (SHOUTING) There’s thousands of them! Run!
ACE: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 76
ACE: FX. ELECTRONIC PULSING OF THE CONTROL UNIT.
CONTROL UNIT: Seed unit captured. Insufficient energy for germination. Inferior life forms engaging. Secondary scout-form triggered. Priority: locate fresh power source.
CONTROL UNIT: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL)
CONTROL UNIT: Page 77
CONTROL UNIT: FX. WE’RE IN THE SAME ROOM AS FERRANDO NOW, CRASHING AROUND AS
CONTROL UNIT: HE’S ‘TRIGGERED’ BY THE CONTROL UNIT.
FERRANDO: FX. MEL AND ROMERO ENTER.
MEL: Senor Ferrando? — Juan, he’s glowing..!
ROMERO: Like Phillipe last night, like that thing...!
ROMERO: FX. AS IN SCENE 20, THE CRACKING OF BONE AND TEARING OF FLESH AS FERRANDO CHANGES FORM, BECOMING A CUELEBRE.
MEL: That’s not Senor Ferrando! Not any more!
ROMERO: Get back! (COCKS HIS REVOLVER) The last one didn’t like being
ROMERO: shot much.
MEL: No, Commander!
MEL: FX. SHE LASHES OUT AT HIM. HE DROPS THE GUN.
ROMERO: Ah! — My gun! What are you doing!
MEL: We can’t just kill it. For all we know, Ferrando might still
MEL: alive in there, somehow.
ROMERO: I doubt it’s feeling quite so generous towards us.
MEL: Run!
MEL: FX. THEY RUN.
MEL: be
MEL: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 78
MEL: FX. ACE AND NEWMAN ON THE RUN, FORCING THEMSELVES OUT OF THE
NARROW: PASSAGE AND INTO THE TUNNEL BEYOND.
ACE: Keep moving!
NEWMAN: (SARCASTIC) I hadn’t thought of that!
NEWMAN: FX. THE BATS ARE SWIRLING AROUND THEM, SWOOPING AND ATTACKING.
ACE: Ah! (SWINGING FOR THEM. EFFORT NOISES) Get! Off! Me!
ACE: FX. THEY RUN ALONG THE TUNNEL.
ACE: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 79
ACE: FX. MEL AND ROMERO RUNNING FROM THE CUELEBRE.
MEL: Juan! In here!
MEL: FX. THEY RUN INTO A ROOM AND SHE SLAMS THE DOOR BEHIND THEM. IMMEDIATELY THE CUELEBRE BEGINS BEATING ON THE WOOD.
ROMERO: Bedroom. No other door. We’re trapped.
MEL: Just find something to barricade the door! That dresser, if we can pull that in front of it.
ROMERO: Hold on.
ROMERO: FX. HE RUNS TO THE DRESSER, STARTS SHOVING IT. NOISE RUNS UNDER FOLLOWING.
MEL: (EFFORT) Quickly!
MEL: FX. THE CUELEBRE BEATING AT THE DOOR STILL.
MEL: (MAJOR EFFORT) It’s too strong! I can’t... hold...
ROMERO: Nearly there! Move!
ROMERO: FX. HE SLAMS THE DRESSER AGAINST THE DOOR. CUELEBRE KEEPS TRYING TO FORCE ITS WAY IN THROUGHOUT THE SCENE.
MEL: That won’t hold for long.
MEL: FX. SHE PULLS OUT THE WALKIE TALKIE. CRACKLE OF RADIO STATIC.
ROMERO: What are you doing?
MEL: Calling the Doctor.
CROSS TO: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 80
CROSS TO: FX. MEL’S VOICE COMING THROUGH ON THE WALKIE TALKIE MUFFLED IN THE DOCTOR’S POCKET.
MEL: Doctor? Doctor, can you hear me?
MEL: FX. DOCTOR PULLS OUT THE WALKIE TALKIE. MEL’S VOICE IS CLEARER NOW.
MEL: Doctor?
DOCTOR: Mel? What’s wrong?
MEL: Ferrando. He’s turned into one of those things. A cooey-libra, like Ace says. He’s got us cornered.
DOCTOR: (TO HIMSELF, PANICKED) No, no, no.. (TO MEL) Mel? Whatever you do, don’t let it touch you! Do you hear me?
STRAIGHT INTO NEXT SCENE: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 81
STRAIGHT INTO NEXT SCENE: FX. CUELEBRE STILL BEATING ON THE DOOR, THE DOCTOR’S VOICE CONTINUOUS FROM PREVIOUS SCENE.
DOCTOR: Don’t let it touch you!
MEL: Easier said than done.
MEL: FX. THE DOOR BEGINS TO SPLIT.
ROMERO: It’s getting in...!
ROMERO: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 82
ROMERO: 45A. EXT. CAVE.
ROMERO: FX. ACE AND NEWMAN PULLING THEMSELVES UP INTO THE OPEN. THE SOUND OF THE BATS MORE DISTANT.
NEWMAN: Almost there, give me your hand!
ACE: I’m alright!
NEWMAN: But I’m not! Give me your hand!
ACE: Come on!
ACE: FX. EFFORT NOISES AS SHE HELPS PULL HIM UP.
NEWMAN: The bats.
ACE: Seem happy to stay down there. Looks like we’re in the clear.
ACE: FX. A LOW, FELINE GROWL.
NEWMAN: Oh no... I’m not sure of that.
ACE: What is it? (BEAT) Oh.
ACE: FX. MORE GROWLING. A LARGE PACK OF LYNX, CIRCLING THEM.
NEWMAN: Lynx.
ACE: Lynx aren’t dangerous, are they?
NEWMAN: Neither are bats, normally. But with a pack this size... There must be twenty or thirty! What’s drawing them all?
ACE: Us. They’re after us.
ACE: FX. THE LYNX ROAR.
ACE: #215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 83

elements.text: PART THREE
FX. MORE GROWLING. A LARGE PACK OF LYNX, CIRCLING THEM.
Lynx.
Lynx aren’t dangerous, are they?
Neither are bats normally. But with a pack this size.. There must be twenty or thirty! What’s drawing them all?
Us. They’re after us.
FX. THE LYNX ROAR.
SCENE CONTINUES:
45B. EXT. CAVE [CONTINUOUS].
(SOFTLY) Get back into the caves, George.
What’s to stop them following us down there?
(SNAPPY) I don’t know! Got any better ideas?
FX. IN THE DISTANCE THE DOCTOR HAS ARRIVED, HIS VOICE CARRYING
THEM.
(SHOUTING) Ace! Get ready to run!
FX. THE LYNX HOWL, A TERRIBLE, DISTRESSED SOUND.
They’re scattering. What’s wrong with them?
Who cares? You heard the Doctor. Run!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 84
FX. THEY SPRINT TOWARDS THE DOCTOR. THE SOUND OF THE HOWLING
GROWING FAINTER BEHIND THEM. AS THEY REACH THE DOCTOR HE
FOR AIR.
(OUT OF PUFF) I think we’re alright now, they don’t seem to be following.
What did you do?
I used this.
A dog whistle?
A very special dog whistle. (LIKE A SMALL CHILD WITH A
TOY) Look, I can control frequency, volume...
(INTERRUPTING) You don’t have a dog.
(DEFENSIVE) I used to. And when I wanted to call him, I often needed a bit of extra oomph.
Lynx aren’t dogs.
(GETTING SNIPPY) They’re still susceptible to high frequencies. It worked, didn’t it?
Yeah. But why did they turn on us in the first place?
That’s a conversation for later. Mel’s in trouble.
FX. PULLS OUT HIS WALKIE TALKIE.
What’s with the toy dinosaur?
It’s not a toy, it’s a — Well, it is a toy. Oh, never mind! (INTO WALKIE TALKIE) Mel? Can you hear me, Mel? (BEAT) Mel?
What’s happening?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 85
Nothing good. (ANGRY) Speak to me, Mel!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 86
46. EXT. FERRANDO’S HOUSE.
FX. A MOMENT OF SILENCE, THEN “SMASH” A WINDOW EXPLODES OUTWARD. MEL AND ROMERO APPEAR AT THE WINDOW.
You first, it’s not far to jump.
It’s far enough!
FX. SHE BRUSHES AWAY BROKEN GLASS THEN JUMPS, HITTING THE GROUND WITH A GRUNT.
EFFORT NOISE
Look out below!
FX. HE JUMPS AFTER HER.
EFFORT NOISE
FX. HE LANDS.
Broken anything?
(WINDED) I don’t think so.
Me neither.
FX. IN MEL’S POCKET, THE DOCTOR’S VOICE ON THE WALKIE TALKIE:
Mel! Come in, Mel!
FX. MEL PULLS OUT THE WALKIE TALKIE.
I’m OK Doctor, just a little busy at the moment.
FX. DISTANT SOUND OF THEIR BARRICADE GIVING WAY, THEN THE
APPEARS AT THE WINDOW.
SCREECHES FROM WINDOW
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 87
We need to gather my men.
As long as we’re getting away from that, I’m happy.
Then hurry! It’s going to jump!
FX. THEY BEGIN TO RUN. BEHIND THEM, CUELEBRE LANDS ON GROUND.
SCREECHES
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 88
47. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. LUIS NOW FREE OF THE CAVES, BRUSHING HIMSELF DOWN.

I know! Very lucky to get out of there. Quite a climb, yes. And I’m not in the best of condition... (A BEAT, REALISING SOMETHING) My hands... wait, that doesn’t make sense. They’re perfect, there’s no sign of... (TRAILS OFF, THEN: )
FX. HE STARTS TEARING OFF HIS CLOTHES. NOISE RUNNING UNDERNEATH THE BELOW.
My chest! Look at my chest! It’s... (BEAT) It’s a miracle! — What, that’s what you were about to say? Well, you’d not seen fit to say so before, had you? I’m — I’m cured!
FX. RUNS OFF, CELEBRATORY WHOOPS AND LAUGHING.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 89
48. INT. CONTROL UNIT CAVERN
FX. HUM OF ELECTRONICS

Tertiary test subject escaped. Connection with inferior lifeforms severed. Power reserves: now at emergency levels. Operation analysis: thirty four percent. Prognosis: Poor. Channeling all remaining power to secondary scout-form. Mission imperative: trigger wide-scale network for power harvesting.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 90
49. EXT. CAVES.
FX. THE DOCTOR, ACE AND NEWMAN APPROACHING THE CAVES.
I hope Mel’s alright...
(SUPPORTIVE) She can look after herself. — Looks like you scared those pussycats off for good.
Yes, I hope I didn’t them any harm. They’re nearly extinct.
Yeah, so were we.
At least we got out with this.
Oh?
Some strange globe. Found it in the tunnels.
FX. HE UNWRAPS THE SPHERE, WE CAN HEAR IT PULSE VERY FAINTLY.
(PANIC) Ah! Drop it! Quickly!
FX. HE BEGINS PATTING HIS POCKETS. NEWMAN DROPS THE SPHERE. IT GIVES A LOUDER PULSE AS IT HITS THE GROUND.
What is it? What’s wrong?
Get back! That thing is the source of all our problems. (STILL
POCKETS) Somewhere here I have a.. Aha!
FX. HE PULLS SOMETHING FROM HIS POCKET.
What’s that, then?
Emergency phone charger!
FX: HE PRESSES A BUTTON AND THERE’S A LOW, BEEPING SOUND.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 91
What good will that do? We don’t want to make a phone call!
Well, yes, it’s slightly illegal actually. It siphons energy from nearby sources to boost your battery.
FX. THE PULSING OF THE SPHERE, ALREADY FAINT, STOPS ALTOGETHER. THE BEEPING STOPS AS THE DOCTOR TURNS OFF HIS CHARGER.
Terribly useful in an emergency, though. I could get hours of extra call time now.
The sphere’s stopped glowing.
Completely drained of energy. It’s inert. Should be safe.
But what is it?
Some species call it a God Seed.
Very dramatic.
A lot of species are. It’s a genetic seeding device.
(SARCASTIC) Oh good, glad that’s sorted out then.
Nobody knows when they were first created, it’s so long ago, but they were sent out on the winds of the universe...
Like dandelion seeds?
SLIGHTLY EXASPERATED AT THE INTERRUPTION) Not remotely. (BEAT
Well, not quite. There’s a control unit as well as the seeds themselves, they divide on landing.
We didn’t see a control unit. (BEAT) What does a control unit look like?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 92
Do you want me to explain or not?
Sorry old chap.
They land on other planets, waiting to be activated.
(SHOCKED) Other planets?
Where did you think our Cooey Libra came from? Leicester? This is space stuff, pay attention.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 93
50. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. MEL AND ROMERO RUNNING TOWARDS THE CHURCH. BEHIND THEM, THE SOUND OF THE CUELEBRE FLYING IN PURSUIT. ITS WINGS BEATING THE AIR.
It’s gaining on us!
It can fly, of course it’s gaining on us. I wish I still had my gun.
sorry.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 94
51. EXT CAVES.
They absorb the DNA of the resident lifeforms, add it to their own and create a new species, a hybrid.
That’s why that thing looked like such a mess? A bit bird, a bit lizard...
And now a bit human. A piece of Phillipe’s consciousness and DNA, now Mayor Ferrando... No hatching is the same. A constantly shifting, mutating species.
But why?
Great way to invade. No space ships or battles, just a viral infection.
Precisely. It creates a handful of initial hybrids as a spearhead.
An army of patient zeroes.
If you like. They spread the infection through touch.
Each world is fully-converted, the original dominant life-form absorbed. And then...
It sends more seeds off to the next planet?
Yes. (BEAT) But they were thought to have been eradicated millennia ago.
Clearly not.
There was a universe-wide purge. By.. well, by a very powerful race.
A time-travelling one that normally bangs on about not interfering?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 95
The High Council decided it had no choice. If left to flourish they foresaw a time when the entire universe would be seeded.
Well they didn’t do a very good job, did they? Otherwise we wouldn’t be looking at this thing now.
(RUSTLE OF PAPER AS HE TURNS A PAGE IN HIS NOTEBOOK) And what were these creatures called?
I don’t think you could pronounce the High Gallif— [reyan] (SURPRISED) Mr Newman! Are you taking notes?
I’m a reporter, of course I’m taking notes.
It’s the invasion of the Cooey Libras!
(CORRECTING HER, AS ALWAYS) Cuélebre! But it’s as good a name as any, I suppose.
So how can they control the wildlife?
They can dominate and control most things, but less intelligent lifeforms are easier.
Better watch out, George.
Well, thank you very much!
The control unit must be low on power. Hardly surprising considering how long it’s probably been buried.
Until the bombs disturbed it.
The kinetic energy may even have activated it. They’re very resourceful, they can convert most things into a viable power resource.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 96
So what are we going to do then?
(THINKS FOR A MOMENT) If it’s that low on power I can probably drain the rest. Render the whole thing inert.
Back to the bat cave!
Yes, and if I’m quick it may also knock out our infected mayor,
which should keep Mel safe.
Come on then! We’1ll show you the way.
FX. THEY DESCEND INTO THE CAVES.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 97
52. EXT FARISSA SQUARE (CONT. FROM SCENE 50).
FX. MEL AND ROMERO ON THE RUN, THE CUELEBRE SWOOPS DOWN.
Don’t let it touch you, Juan!
FX. THEY DIVE, EFFORT AS THEY HIT THE GROUND AND ROLL. THE
SCREECHES.
& ROMERO:
EFFORT NOISES
SCREECHES
Missed!
We can’t avoid it forever.
FX. GENERAL HUBBUB, THE CUELEBRE HAS ATTRACTED ATTENTION,
COMING OUT OF THEIR HOMES.
x 3: Mother Mary!/ The Cuélebre!/ We must do something! [ETC]
Oh no... that’s all we need!
(SHOUTING TO THE CROWDS) You people! Get back inside! Bar your windows! Lock your doors!
SCREECHES
It’s going for them!
#1: (ATTACKED) Aah!!
It’s got Pedro!/ Get it off him!
(TO TOWNSFOLK) Leave that man be! You can do nothing!
(TO TOWNSFOLK) Whatever you do, don’t let it touch you!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 98
SCREECHES
FX. IT SLASHES AT 3 x TOWNSFOLK.
CRY OUT, SLASHED
FX. MULTIPLE PULSES OF ENERGY. THEN THE SOUND OF CRACKING BONE AND TEARING FLESH AS THE INFECTION SPREADS AND TOWNSPEOPLE ARE CONVERTED.
They’re all changing! All it did was touch them and they began to change!
Leave them, Juan! There’s nothing we can do! The church — come on!
You think we should pray?
We just need to get under cover!
FX. THEY RUN.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 99
53. INT. CONTROL UNIT CAVERN
FX. HUM OF ELECTRONICS
Wide-scale infection triggered. Last power reserves draining. Prepare harvesting network.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 100
54. EXT. ESPERANZA
FX. LUIS RUNNING THROUGH THE STREETS OF HIS VILLAGE, THE SOUND OF THE RUNNING RIVER AND THE CHURNING OF THE WATER MILL RUNS THROUGHOUT THE SCENE.
(SHOUTING) Everyone! Look! It’s a miracle!
Look, it’s Luis! / Look at his skin!
FX. ONE OF LUIS’ FELLOW SUFFERERS APPROACHES.
Luis? You’re cured! How is it possible?
I told you! A miracle, my friend! Here —
FX. LUIS HUGS HIM VIOLENTLY. PATTING HIM ON THE BACK. SUDDENLY THERE IS A PULSE OF ENERGY, JUST AS HEARD IN SCENE 48, THE
TRANSFER.
(SHOCK) Ah! Your touch, it burns!
No, my friend. Don’t you see...?
(DISBELIEVING) My skin! I’m. I’m..!
Now you’re cured too! (LAUGHS ECSTATICALLY )
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 101
55. INT. CAVES
FX. THE DOCTOR, ACE AND NEWMAN WORKING THEIR WAY THROUGH THE TUNNELS.
I’m glad you had a torch, Doctor. Is there anything you can’t find in your pockets?
The right change for vending machines. It’s a universal rule.
The bats have gone to bed.
Good.
Another sign that its power supply is on its last legs. (BEAT) Hopefully.
For once it looks like we’ve hit lucky.
I’d hardly call the last few hours lucky.
You want to meet us on a bad day. — Just through here,
Professor.
FX. THEY SQUEEZE THROUGH THE NARROW PASSAGE.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 102
56. EXT. ESPERANZA.
FX. GENERAL CELEBRATORY WILDTRACK, LUIS’ CURE BEING SPREAD FROM
PERSON TO THE NEXT. THE SOUND OF THE MILL AND THE RIVER.
Hooray! / Cured! / Look at me! Just look at me!
We’re all cured. (BEAT) What’s that? (BEAT) Oh well, you would try and take the credit, wouldn’t you? Seems to me I did most of the hard work. (ALOUD) Today is a very good day!
CHEER
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 103
57. INT. CAVES.
FX. THE DOCTOR, ACE AND NEWMAN STEP OUT INTO THE LARGE CAVERN.
Look, all the seeds are inactive.
But where’s this control unit of yours?
It’ll be hidden. Cloaked.
FX. CRACKLE OF HIS WALKIE TALKIE
Doctor? Are you there?
FX. HE PULLS OUT THE WALKIE TALKIE.
I’m here, Mel. Are you safe?
For now. —
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 104
58. INT. CHURCH [CONTINUOUS]
Juan and I, we’ve barricaded ourselves inside the church.
(OFF, CALLING) Jorge, take a couple of men up to the roof. These things can fly!
FX. SOLDIERS RUNNING OFF THROUGH:
You’re not alone?
No, we’re with the rest of Juan’s men. Doctor, the creature — the cuélebre, it got among the townsfolk. They’ve all turned into those... things!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 105
59. INT. CAVES [CONTINUOUS]
(TO DOCTOR) I thought you said they were low on power?
Once the viral exchange is genetically programmed it runs independently. All it needed was one activated subject.
Juan — the Commander — he thinks that if he can get his field
radio going, he can call up reinforcements.
No, that’s the last thing we need. —
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 106
60. INT. CHURCH [CONTINUOUS]
Stay put, Mel. I’m doing what I can here.
Well, please do it quickly! Melanie out.
FX. FROM OUTSIDE, MANY CUELEBRE FLAPPING WINGS, SCREECHING.
OUTSIDE — ASSORTED SCREECHING
We will not be able to hold them for long.
It’s alright, Juan. The Doctor’s all the reinforcements we need.
You really think he can help against this?
Believe me, this is an everyday situation so far as the Doctor’s concerned.
Everyday?!
Like war is to you. You get used to it, I suppose.
You’re very strong, Melanie.
(DEFENSIVE) For a woman?
For anyone. (SMILES) Don’t suppose you fancy joining up?
I’m not the soldiering type.
Running around dealing with oppressive monsters and saving lives? I'd say you were very much a soldier.
It’s different.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 107
If you say so. But I’d like it if you stayed.
FX. OUTSIDE THE SOUND OF THE CUELEBRE ABRUPTLY CEASES, THEY DON’T NOTICE.
(SLIGHT FLIRT) Why? Because I’d make a good soldier?
Maybe because you might make a good farmer.
(REALISATION) Hang on, it’s gone very quiet out there.
Move over, let me take a look through the peephole.
FX. FEW STEPS TO DOOR. HE SWINGS OPEN CREAKY COVER OVER PEEPHOLE.
(SOTTO) Well?
(SOTTO) Strange... the creatures, they’re all just stood there.
(SOTTO) Show me. (THEY SWAP PLACES.) It’s like they’re ina trance.
(SOTTO) Is that a good or bad thing?
(SOTTO) I have absolutely no idea.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 108
61. INT CAVES.
FX. THE DOCTOR IS SCRABBLING THROUGH THE ROCKS, THROWING THEM ASIDE, HUNTING. HE KEEPS THIS UP THROUGHOUT THE FOLLOWING.
Mr Newman, would you please hold that torch steady?!
(SEARCHING, OFF) Yeah, it’s hard enough trying to find this control unit without you plunging us into darkness every few seconds.
Sorry, I was just keeping an eye out for bats.
Bats are nothing to worry about!
(OFF) Unless they’re vampire bats.
(CONCERNED) Vampire bats?
Even then, they’re not a problem.
(OFF) Unless they’re actual vampires.
(EVEN MORE CONCERNED) Actual vampires?
The Time Lords wiped them out. (BEAT) Most of them. (BEAT) I think.
Time Lords?
The same people that dealt with the Cuélebre.
But they didn’t, did they? That’s why we’re here!
Well, yes, there is that. (HE FINDS WHAT HE WAS LOOKING FOR) Aha!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 109
FX. SLIGHT BEEPING, REGULAR, LIKE A BURGLAR ALARM. ACE COMES
OVER. JUMPING ACROSS THE ROCKS.
You found what we’re looking for?
I believe I have.
That’s it? That’s the control unit?
It’s a bit small.
Well, yes, it’s not the control unit. Just, a control unit.
For what?
The holographic shield hiding the control unit.
This is all rather confusing.
Just nod from time to time, that’s all he wants.
The torch! Shine it on here for me.
FX. HE STARTS WORKING. OCCASIONAL BLEEPS AS HE PRESSES BUTTONS AND TINKERS, RUNNING UNDERNEATH THE FOLLOWING. THE CRACKLE OF THE WALKIE TALKIE.
Doctor?
Get that for me, would you, Ace?
Doctor, are you there?
Give me your dinosaur. (TAKES WALKIE TALKIE) This is the Doctor’s messaging service. You alright, Mel?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 110
Fine. I think. The creatures have all just stopped moving. They’re just stood there, staring into space, like they’ve been... I don’t know, ‘turned off’ somehow.
FX. DOCTOR’S TINKERING NOISES CEASE.
What? Oh dear... that’s not good.
FX. STARTS TINKERING AGAIN.
What did he say?
That’s not good. Apparently.
(PARTIALLY DISTRACTED, WORKING AT THE SAME TIME) I told you the Cuélebre could convert most things to a power source?
Yeah?
The human body is a perfectly good source of electrical energy. Limited... but if you have enough bodies...
Like a whole town?
I’m working as quickly as I can.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 111
62. CONTROL UNIT CAVERN.
FX. HUM OF ELECTRONICS
Chemical power source engaged. Wetware cells online. Transferring. Back-up power supply now at two percent.. three percent... four percent...
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 112
63. INT CHURCH.
FX. GENERAL ACTIVITY OF SOLDIERS, BUSTLING AROUND, MAKING SURE THEY’RE SECURE.
Well? What did the Doctor say?
He seems to think that the creatures draining the townspeople of energy. Like... walking batteries.
Well, what happens once they’ve done that?
He didn’t say.
So something bad, yes?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 113
64. INT. CAVES/CONTROL UNIT CAVERN.
FX. THE DOCTOR TINKERING, BEEPS AND BUTTONS.
Can you stop it Doctor?
Only if I can get at it! And to get at it (PUNCTUATED WITH
AS HE WORKS ON THE DEVICE) I need to make this thing do as it’s told!
FX. A SUDDEN WAVE OF SOUND. THE SHIELD DROPPING, TO REVEAL THE REST OF THE CONTROL UNIT CAVERN (IT’S BEEN SHIELDED TIL NOW).
CONTROL UNIT FX.
Like that?
Just like that.
That’s it, then? That’s the main control unit?
It’s huge, like a.. like... (GIVES UP) I don’t know what it’s like.

84. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. ACE, THE DOCTOR AND NEWMAN, RUNNING TOWARDS THE TARDIS.
What did you want the sphere for?
To reprogram it.
FX. RATTLE OF KEYS, HE UNLOCKS THE TARDIS.
(SLIGHTLY SARCASTIC) Your police box? Planning on bringing in Scotland Yard, are you?
You'll see. Step inside George, I’1l hold your jaw for you when it drops.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 139
85. INT. CHURCH TOWER.
FX. WE CAN STILL HEAR THE CUELEBRE SCREECHING RANDOMLY OUTSIDE BUT THEY’RE FAINT. ROMERO HAVING HOLED HIMSELF UP IN THE TOWER. THE CRACKLE AND WHINE OF THE RADIO AS HE POWERS IT UP (OLD
ETC).

Hello, this is Farissa calling Nationalist forces. Farissa calling Nationalist forces. Republican commander Juan Romero is hiding in the town with the full support of the locals. Last night’s bomb raid caused minimal casualties. A further strike would wipe out both him and his men. This is an opportunity for a major Nationalist victory. Suggest bombing raid ordered as soon as possible. Map reference to follow...
FX. HE PULLS OUT A MAP.

(TO HIMSELF) Who would have thought I’d be banking on the Nationalists to save the country? (INTO THE RADIO) This is Farissa, I repeat, this is Farissa, is anyone receiving me? Map reference for aerial strike follows...
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 140
86. INT. TARDIS
FX. TARDIS ATMOSPHERE.
I say.. I’ve never seen the like...
FX. THE DOCTOR BUSIES HIMSELF AT THE CONSOLE.
I know, the control unit caused an awful mess. It’s mostly superficial though, a few burned-out circuits...
That’s not what he meant, Doctor, and you know it.
(JOKING) Well, if you tidied up after yourself once in a while I wouldn’t be so embarrassed to accept guests.
(DEADPAN) Ha ha. Are you alright, George?
Fine. Brilliant. Stupendous. Possibly drunk?
It takes a bit of getting used to.
FX. THE DOCTOR FINISHES FIDDLING.
There, that’1ll stop them trying to steal my power again. Now to take a look at the sphere.
FX. HE OPENS A ROUNDEL, PULLING OUT SOME WIRES AND GADGETRY.
What are you going to do with all that then?
Wire the sphere up to the TARDIS databanks, reprogram it to transmit human baseline DNA.
Create our very own God Seed?
Precisely. Take it to Farissa and let it wreak havoc on the transformed townsfolk.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 141
And once they’re all back to normal we go back and blow up the control unit. (MOCK INNOCENT) I can do that bit if you like? You know... if it’s helpful.
(GENTLY REMONSTRATING) Ace... If you really want to help?
(ENTHUSIASTIC) Yeah?
Check on Mel.
How? — Oh yeah, still got that stupid dinosaur.
FX. SHE PULLS OUT THE WALKIE TALKIE.
Mel? It’s Ace, are you reading me? Mel?
FX. NOTHING BUT CRACKLE.
That’s not good.
(ANGRY AT HIMSELF MORE THAN ANYTHING) Surely she stayed in the church? She should have been fine!
Against a whole town of cooey libras?
That church was built to withstand invading armies of Moors! She should have been perfectly secure.
(TRYING AGAIN) Mel? Can you hear me Mel?
FX. THE DOCTOR BUSIES HIMSELF WITH HIS WIRES AND THE SPHERE.
Keep trying, I’ll rig this up as quickly as I can.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 142
87. INT. CHURCH TOWER.
FX. ROMERO TURNS OFF THE RADIO. A BEAT.

(TO HIMSELF) Forgive me Mel, if there is anything of you left inside that... thing. But it’s all I can do. In about twenty minutes there’1ll be nothing but noise, light and fire. And then we'll all be back to those quiet fields. Forever.
FX. THE TARDIS MATERIALISES DOWNSTAIRS.
What in heaven’s name was that?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 143
88. INT. CHURCH [NAVE, DOWNSTAIRS]
FX. A BEAT. TARDIS DOORS OPEN.
Mel?
(PUSHING PAST) Mind out, Professor. (CALLING OUT) Mel? Mel!
FX. NEWMAN FOLLOWS THEM OUT. DOOR CLOSED BEHIND.
(TO HIMSELF) Magic box brings us to the church. Of course it does. Magic box can do anything.
(SHOUTING) Mel! (TO THE DOCTOR) Where is she, Professor?
FX. ROMERO COMES DOWN THE STEPS.
They caught her. The creatures... I tried to save her, but...
She’s become one of them?!?
It’s alright, Ace, I’ll get her back. I promise.
You hope.
How did you get in here (SPOTS THE TARDIS) and what’s that box doing?
Never mind that box. We need to get to work.
The Doctor has a trick up his sleeve, that glowing gadget of his.
FX. SPHERE BEGINS PULSING.
That can save her? Save all of them?
It’s called a God Seed but we’ve broken it.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 144
Broken it in useful and effective ways. We need to be careful. If we just walk out there...
We'll be swamped before we can do anything.
Precisely. It should be quick. But the numbers aren’t exactly on our side.
I don’t understand much but it sounds like you need a distraction.
You've got it. Professor, I’1ll run out of the door, and when the cooey libras start chasing me, you can come behind and start blasting them with that thing.
That’s terribly dangerous.
Yeah, well, I can hack it. Anyway, if they convert me you’1l just have to convert me back won’t you?
If it even works. The two viral infections will be fighting one another. I think a secondary infection will dominate the first, but...
You just do your thing, old man. If anyone can sort this out, it’s you.
(SLIGHTLY DISTANT) Be ready.
Eh? — Juan!
FX. ROMERO THROWS BACK THE BOLTS OF THE CHURCH DOOR.
Make sure Mel’s alright, won’t you? (RUNS OUT OF DOOR, INTO: )
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 145
89. EXT. CHURCH [CONTINUOUS]
FX. ROMERO RUNS OUT OF THE DOOR SHOUTING.
Come on then! You wanted me to join you? Let’s see if you’re worthy!
FX. CUELEBRE SCREECH, SOME SHOUTING.
Get him!/ Seize him! [ETC]
No!!! He’s mine!
FX. ROMERO RUNS OFF.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 146
90. INT. CHURCH.
FX. THE LOUD PULSE OF THE SPHERE.
Quickly, Professor!
I’ll help.
FX. HE RUNS TO THE DOOR.
George! You’re not going out there too?
“Adrenaline junkie”, remember? More the merrier will get you the distraction you need. Just do what has to be done.
FX. HE RUNS OUT.
Come on, Ace! After them.
FX. THEY FOLLOW.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 147
92. EXT. CHURCH.
FX. ROMERO SPRINTING ALONG. CUELEBRE TRYING TO CATCH HIM,
WINGS, ALIEN SNARLS.
CHASING, SNARLING
You can’t run forever, Juan!
(PATRONIZING) Of course I can! I’ve spent the last three years avoiding death and capture. I’m a master at it. Keep up.
SCREECHES LOUDLY, RIGHT ON TOP OF US/HIM
FX. ROMERO SKIDS ON THE GROUND. THEN BREAKS FOR FREEDOM, HIS
ZIPPING RIGHT ACROSS THE STEREO FIELD.
Too slow, my friends! Too slow!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 148
93. EXT. CHURCH.
FX. NEWMAN RUNNING. CUELEBRE SURROUNDING HIM.
CHASING, SNARLING
I was winger on the school Rugger team, not a man could lay his
hands on me, I’d like to see you lot do better!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 149
94. EXT. CHURCH.
FX. THE PULSE OF THE SPHERE. ACE AND THE DOCTOR RUNNING.
Got it! It’s working!
Then use it!
FX. A CUELEBRE BEARING DOWN ON THE DOCTOR AND ACE.
Doctor...
I know that one..! It’s the Mayor of the Cooey Libras!
Doctor!!!
(TO DOCTOR) They can speak now?
They’ve absorbed the human language as part of this hatching. Get back, Ace, you’re in the line of fire. (BEAT) Right... Cross your fingers... aaand...
FX. CRACKLE OF ELECTRICITY. HITS THE CUELEBRE. IT SCREECHES.
(CUELEBRE) Ahhh!!!!
FX. CONVERSION SOUND. FERRANDO’S SCREAM SUDDENLY BECOME HUMAN.
It works!
(CLEARLY VERY RELIEVED) Of course it does. (RUNNING OVER) Mr Mayor? Antonio?
Doctor? I.. Mother Mary, what happened to me?
The same thing that’s happened to the rest of your town, I’m afraid.
FX. ANOTHER CUELEBRE.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 150
SCREECH
FX. THE SPHERE FIRES AGAIN. THE CUELEBRE SCREAMS AND, ONCE AGAIN THE SCREAM BECOMES HUMAN.
Aaah!!!
Two down!
Only a few hundred more to go.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 151
95. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. ROMERO STILL ON THE RUN. HE SKIDS, HE FALLS.
(EFFORT AS HE HITS THE GROUND).
Got you now!
Is that you, Rodrigo? Come on then, see if you’re a better monster than you were a cook!
FX. IT GRABS HIM. HIS LAST LINE SHIFTING IN TONE AS HE TRANSFORMS.
For the Republic! This land (CHANGES) is mine!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 152
96. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. THE CONSTANT PULSE AND FIZZ OF THE SPHERE, THE DOCTOR DOING
BEST TO CATCH AS MANY AS HE CAN.
Take that! And you! And another... Oh this is all going surprisingly well!
(GENERAL RESPONSE NOISES) Ah! / Oh! / Urgghh!
Doctor! Over there! They’ve got Juan! Where’s George? George? (SPOTS HIM) Oh ho! (SHOUTING) George... behind you!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 153
97. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. NEWMAN, EXHAUSTED, BREATHING HEAVILY.
4 x CUELEBRE:
SURROUND HIM, SNARLING
Four on one, eh? Not very sporting. Well come on, then...
FX. THEY GRAB HIM, HIS LINE TRANSFORMING IN TONE AS HE
. do your worst!
DOES.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 154
98. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE
FX. BACK TO ACE AND THE DOCTOR, STILL USING THE SPHERE.
Too many! There are just.. too many!
Doctor, look out!!!
SCREECHES AND LASHES OUT...
WIND KNOCKED OUT OF HIM AS HE FALLS
FX. SPHERE PULSES LOUDLY AS IT FALLS FROM HIS HANDS.
No! The sphere...
FX. THE TRANSFORMED MEL WALKS TOWARDS HIM, HER VOICE FADING IN.
Butterfingers, Doctor. Did you drop your little toy?
Mel?
Mel, please! I know you’re still her. Inside. Still our friend. Still the brave and wonderful Melanie Bush. Fight it!
It’s a pretty toy, Doctor. But I have one too.
FX. SHE COCKS A GUN.
Is your toy bullet-proof, I wonder?
No, Mel! Please! Fight it!
Mel! You don’t have to do this, you’re strong... you can control this.
(CONFUSED) Control? Doctor? Ace...?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 155
That’s it, Mel!
Control? (THE ALIEN DNA REASSERTS ITSELF) Why would I want to?
FX. GUNSHOT. THE SPHERE PULSES AND EXPLODES. BEAT.
No, apparently it’s not bullet-proof. (TRIUMPHANTLY) Anti-viral threat neutralised!
SCREECH TRIUMPHANTLY
No!
FX. ACE AND THE DOCTOR HUDDLED CLOSE. THEIR VOICES QUIET, FINAL.
You tried your best, Professor.
It wasn’t good enough.
Take my hand, Doctor, Mel. We can all be best friends again.
LAUGHS
FX. LUIS AND THE REST OF HIS VILLAGERS ARE APPROACHING.
(DISTANCE) Hello! Are you having a fiesta? We love fiesta days!
Is that... Luis?
And the rest of his village, it looks like. (SHOUTING) Luis! Get back! All of you! Run!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 156
99. EXT. FARISSA
FX. WE MOVE CLOSE ON LUIS. A CUELEBRE ADVANCES ON HIM.
You will join us!
Lovely costumes! Very impressive! May I feel?
FX. LUIS TOUCHES HIM, THE TRANSFORMATION SOUND.
(SHOCKED) Oh! I’m sorry! Strange things happen when people touch me. It’s this miracle of mine. I made your costume vanish!
Get them!/ Turn them! [ETC]
FX. THE SOUND OF MULTIPLE TRANSFORMATIONS AS THE CUELEBRE GRAB THE VILLAGERS AND ARE TURNED BACK TO HUMAN. RUNS UNDER ALL OF THE FOLLOWING.
(GENUINELY SORRY) And it seems contagious. All of my friends cna do it now. I’m so sorry — you said you didn’t want my disease and now it’s ruining your lovely costumes!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 157
100. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. THE SOUND OF CUELEBRE BEING TRANSFORMED BACK TO HUMAN RUNS THROUGHOUT. THE SOUND COMING CLOSER.
What’s happening?
I have no idea... Luis and his friends seem able to transform everyone back.
But how?
Right now I don’t care. (CALLS) Luis! Listen to me, touch everyone! You and your friends must touch everyone!
No!
(COMING OVER) It’s Mel, isn’t it? You were Mel. You were kind to. Luis:,
Keep back! Keep away from me!
FX. THERE’S A TRANSFORMATION SOUND. HER NEXT LINE SHIFTS IN
AS SHE’S CHANGED BACK TO THE MEL WE KNOW. SHE FALLS TO THE GROUND.
He’s changed Mel back!
Like that, Doctor?
Exactly like that! But everyone, you must change everyone back.
(UNCERTAIN) If you’re sure?
I’m sure!
Mel? You OK? Mel!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 158
(GROGGY) I think so.. Oh, it was horrible!
I’m so sorry, Mel. I let you down...
FX. ROMERO APPROACHES. HIMSELF AGAIN.
You did nothing of the kind, Doctor.
Soldier boy! You’re you again!
It was me that let her down.
(GROANS) If the pair of you have quite finished... The world doesn’t rest on your shoulders you know. I can stand on my own two feet occasionally.
(LAUGHS) You tell ‘em, Mel!
FX. THEY HUG. NEWMAN APPROACHES.
Are we winning?
George! Good to have you back!
(SUDDEN REALISATION) Oh no..! The bombing raid...!
BEAT
(STEEL) The what?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 159
101. INT. CHURCH.
MUSIC: PUNCH OF ACTION. PACE THROUGH THE ROOF.
FX. DOORS BARREL OPEN AS THE DOCTOR, ROMERO, ACE, MEL AND
SPRINT INTO THE CHURCH TO THE TARDIS.
I’m sorry, I called the Nationalists, told them where I was!
Idiot!
I thought it was our only option, it was that or risk them taking over everything.
(FORGIVING) We know, Juan, we know.
We should evacuate the town. We may still have time.
Under no circumstances. Don’t breathe a word about this. It’s vitally important everyone stays exactly where they are.
What are we going to do then?
FX. THE DOCTOR OPENS THE TARDIS DOORS.
Two birds. One stone. Stay here. All of you. Everyone. It’s important.
FX. SLAMS THE DOORS BEHIND HIM. TARDIS DEMATERIALISES.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 160
102. INT. CONTROL UNIT CAVERN
FX. HUM AND BUZZ OF THE CONTROL UNIT. TARDIS LANDS. DOORS OPEN.
Emergency. Emergency. All scout-forms are reading inoperative. Unknown viral trigger reasserting human baseline.
FX. DOCTOR RUNS OUT, SEARCHING IN THE RUBBLE, THROWING STONES
WAY AND THAT.
(URGENT) Where did I put it? Oh Doctor, your clumsiness will be the death of you one day. (BEAT) And everyone else for that matter.
Supposition. Partially converted secondary scout-form retained viral wetware due to halted conversion. Secondary scout-form spreading human baseline as per programming.
What? You mean you cured and then partially converted Luis? Then let him go? That would explain it! He’s been spreading the good news!
Alert! Higher lifeform detected. Emergency conversion required.
Oops! Learn when to keep your mouth shut, Doctor. (FINDS WHAT HE’S LOOKING FOR) Aha! There it is.
FX. SPHERES BEGIN PULSING ALL AROUND HIM.
Convert! Convert! Convert!
Not today thank you!
FX. VANISHES BACK INTO THE TARDIS. DOORS SHUT. IT DEMATERIALISES.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 161
103. INT. TARDIS.
FX. TARDIS ATMOSPHERE.
(MUMBLING AS HE WORKS) That’s it.. Hover mode. Aerial scanning... Put that there... and swap it with.. that. (BIG SMILE, UTTERLY PLEASED WITH HIMSELF) Oh very good, Doctor!
CUT STRAIGHT TO.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 162
105. EXT. HILLSIDE.
FX. TARDIS LANDS. DOORS OPEN. LIKE GREASED LIGHTNING THE DOCTOR
OUT, IN HIS HANDS THE CONTROL UNIT FOR THE HOLOGRAPHIC SHIELD, WITH ITS REGULAR BURGLAR ALARM STYLE BLEEP.
(BREATHLESS) You’d think... with my lifestyle... I'd always regenerate with long legs...
FX. HE PLACES THE HOLOGRAPHIC SHIELD ON THE GROUND.
Right, stored images... yes. Boost range.. done. Now: Activate!
FX. THE NOISE USED FOR THE HOLOGRAPHIC SHIELD IN SCENE 59. THE
FAINTEST SOUND OF APPROACHING PLANES.
Perfect. (BEAT) There was something else I had to do. Something important...
FX. THE APPROACHING PLANES GETTING LOUDER.
Bombers! That was it! Run!
FX. HE SPRINTS OFF. STRAIGHT INTO THE TARDIS. DOORS CLOSE. IT DEMATERIALISES.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 163
106. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. WE CAN CLEARLY HEAR THE SOUND OF PLANES NOW. TARDIS LANDS.
STEPS OUT. THERE’S A GENERAL HUBBUB OF CONCERN.
Bomber planes!/ The Nationalists!/ They’re coming for us! [ETC]
(DISTANT) Professor?
FX. ACE, ROMERO, MEL AND NEWMAN RUNNING OVER.
(ANNOUNCING TO THE CROWDS, HAPPILY) Don’t worry, everyone! The planes aren’t coming here. Today is a happy day! Fiesta! A taste of the real Spain! O1é!
FX. HIS FRIENDS ARRIVE.
But the planes are coming here!
(STILL VERY PLEASED) Who says? I don’t. Anyone fancy some tapas? I’d love some tapas. It’s been a very long day.
FX. THE PLANES GETTING LOUDER.
(KNOWING) What have you done?
Well, the planes are going to bomb the town.
(EXASPERATED) But this is the town!
I know that. But the men in those planes don’t.
There’s nothing else for miles around. They can see it!
Aha! But that’s the fun bit. They can’t. Remember the control unit?
The big control unit or the small one?
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 164
The small one.
Controlling the (STRUGGLES) hollergryphic...
(INTERRUPTING) Holographic shield thingy.
FX. PLANES ALMOST ON TOP OF THEM.
That’s the one. Well, thanks to the extra boost of power from the TARDIS I was able to stretch its range a bit.
I have no idea what you’re talking about.
Neither do I. But as he’s so cheerful we’re probably fine.
I popped into the TARDIS. Took an aerial image of the town and an aerial image of the caves...
And swapped them!!!
(SLIGHTLY DEFLATED) You stole my punchline.
FX. THE PLANES PASS OVER.
I still don’t altogether get it.
From the air. The bit of hill with the caves in it...
(INTERRUPTING) And the control unit.
The big one. To the bombers, it looks like the town. But the town...
Looks like nothing but hillside. Perfectly hidden.
So they’re bombing the wrong target!
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 165
Well, that rather depends on whether you wanted to destroy a lethal alien seeding unit. doesn’t it?
FX. IN THE DISTANCE BOMBS START FALLING. DISTANT EXPLOSIONS.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 166
107. INT. CONTROL UNIT CAVERN.
FX. DISTANT EXPLOSIONS. CAVERN FALLING IN, TUMBLING ROCKS, DEBRIS. CONTINUES THROUGHOUT.
Emergency. Aerial attack. Damage increasing. Damage...
FX. ONE ALMIGHTY LANDSLIDE. THE CONTROL UNIT CUT OFF WITH AN EXPLOSION OF SPARKS AND A WHINE OF DESTROYED ELECTRONICS.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 167
108. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE.
FX. WE CAN STILL HEAR THE DISTANT BOMBS.
Fireworks for a happy fiesta day! (BEAT) Now I really think I do deserve tapas.
FX. HE WANDERS OFF, HIS VOICE FADING.
(CONT. )
Those nice spicy potato things. And omelette. And manchego [MAN-CHAY-GO] cheese. And alioli [AL-EE-OH-LEE]. And figs.
Maybe even... oh why not... a large glass of nispero juice.
I’m still utterly confused.
Don’t let it worry you, let’s see if a bottle of red wine helps.
Come on Mel, let’s see if we can sneak a glass past the Doctor.
Maybe even two.
FX. THEY ALL START TO WALK AWAY. VOICES FADING.
Oh, I’ve just thought... he seems worryingly cheerful.
Don’t worry. I hid his spoons in the TARDIS ages back.
He’1l find more...
MUSIC: GENTLE TRANSITION
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 168
109. EXT. HILLSIDE (MUCH LATER
FX. THE DISTANT SOUND OF THE FIESTA. A SLIGHT WIND. THE CHIRP OF CICADAS. MEL AND ROMERO, A LITTLE BIT IN LOVE, BUT NOW A TOUCH OF MELANCHOLY.
Juan? — It’s been a lovely party, Juan.
It has. But now you have to go — is that what you’re telling me?
So do you.
The war goes on Mel, my men and I need the rest but... it was never the end.
It could be. You could leave, you know. Come with me?
BEAT
I can’t. You know I can’t.
We could go anywhere. The Doctor can do that. Anywhere. Find a piece of land somewhere...
These are my lands, Mel. I’m fighting to protect them.
But if it kills you?
Then I will die having tried.
Is it worth that?
Someone who has fought monsters for so long and you have to ask? If half of what you’ve told me over the last couple of days is true, you know I have to do this.
What I do with the Doctor is different.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 169
Only through geography. My country is oppressed. My people are dying. I can’t abandon them.
(BEAT. FINALLY ACCEPTING) No.
I could ask you to stay with me...
Oh, Juan...
. but I wouldn’t. This is no life. Not really. If you can choose not to live it.
You choose it.
I do, in the hope that others won’t have to make such a choice. Like you. Go, travel on. Be amazing.
I’1ll try.
You’1l succeed.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 170
elements.character: FX. THEY KISS. SLOW FADE TO

elements.text: 110. EXT. FARISSA SQUARE (LATER
FX. FOLLOWING MORNING. SOUND OF THE FOUNTAIN. LUIS AND FERRANDO
elements.character: FX. THEY KISS. SLOW FADE TO

elements.text: TALKING AS THEY PASS US BY, THEIR CONVERSATION FADING IN FROM THE LEFT AND FADING OUT TO THE RIGHT.
Oh I’m sure we can help. We’re good workers my friends and I and, with the war on, we all need all the help we can get.
We’re happy to trade supplies. If the two towns work together we can make the best of it. (BEAT) I’m sorry for the way we treated you, my friend. It was... un-Christian...
Oh don’t worry about all that. (BEAT) What’s that? He’s trying to apologise, let him! (BEAT) Who’s having this conversation me or you?
I’m sorry.. who are you talking to?
FX. THEY FADE AWAY. WE HOLD OUR POSITION. ACE AND NEWMAN ARE SAT IN THE SQUARE, LISTENING AS WE JUST DID.
Well, the townsfolk seem to be sorting themselves out. There’s been a fair bit of damage to the town what with all those...
Cooey libras.
Yes. Well their stay was brief but they weren’t the best of guests.
FX. MEL ARRIVES.
(SLIGHTLY SUBDUED) Everyone will be fine. Pull together. It’s
what you do in war.
(CONCERNED) You OK, Mel?
(BEAT) Not really. But I will be. Life goes on. For most of us.
FX. THE DOCTOR WALKS UP.
#215: FIESTA OF THE DAMNED by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 171
Time to go.
Yes.
We’re heading out ourselves shortly. Back into the fray.
Keep an eye on him, will you?
(KINDLY) I’11 do my best.
FX. HE GETS UP.
Lovely to meet you all. (CLOSE, TO ACE) Even you, Ace.
(FRIENDLY) Even you, stupid boy.
FX. NEWMAN LEAVES.
Are you ready?
Yes, let’s just go.
FX. GETS UP.
(GENTLE) ‘History hurts’ — wasn’t that what you said, Mel?
Yes. You told me ‘It also inspires’.
We were both right.
BEAT
Come on.
FX. FEW STEPS TO TARDIS. THEY STEP INSIDE. IT DEMATERIALISES. A MOMENT OF SILENCE, JUST THE TRICKLING FOUNTAIN.
MUSIC: CLOSING THEME.
